text: Mariott Hotel  executive  apartment  hotel in Jakarta is  situated  the central area and  it is well located if you neeed to be close to financial district . I selected this Apartment Hotel  as I was in Jakarta for business and as it said, on web site, it has a very nice and well equipped fitness  area. I confirm the fitness area  it is very very nice, and if you are into heavy body building You can accommodate a very proper training session as the gym is fully catered  with Life fitness brand  equipment. The cardio area is also super  well equipped. The gym is on two floor and it is very large, quite, clean.All you need for a good session and more. At lower  floor , 28th floor,  there is a very large pool, with kids pool too. At second floor, 29th floor is located the gym with a breathtaking view of city skyline. Apart from a beautiful gym I can not express a positive opinion. I was assigned a two rooms apartment, yes very large and spacious, with two bedrooms, and two bathrooms, but  all and all the fitting looks very old and the apartment would need to be refurbished. Thery are clean though. There is only one “ restaurant “, if so We may call it,  which is located at ground floor, and which is very very small to cater such a large Hotel apartment block. So in the morning, if you want  to have breakfast, take into consideration it will take some time to be served. The selection of food is   limited, there are no cold cuts and little European style food. For instance there is not a water bowl in the restaurant, so if you want just a glass of water , you need to ask the waiter that takes times  minuts to serve you. I also had a diner in the " restaurant" first night at arrival, and it was just ok. As per the other service, like housekeeping,  I should mention my laundry was delivered to my room late at night, at 9.00 o’clock pm, when all restaurant in Jakarta are closed, so I went out  for diner with client with same shirt I had on all day. Not nice!  In addition to that the set of terry towles  is limited to one piece peer size , even if in the apartment there are two bathrooms there was one set of  terry  towels just in main bathroom and limited, as I said to one piece per size. I called housekeeping for another  2 pieces  of terry pieces and It took 4= minuts to be delivered in my room. All and all I am disappointed. I paid 150  USA dollars per night, which is a lot of money in Jakarta, and I must say I paid for what  I did not get: the service, the morning breakfast and the restaurant do not really work, they need to be refurbished, they need to fix air conditioning as temperature inbreakfast lounge is far too hot. my apartment was old and  looked very “ empty” and not cosy at all. The level of service is  poor, and the only positive things in this apartment hotel is the great GYM at 28th floor. I will not come back in Jakarta and I would not suggest to other business travelers.
title: A great gym and pool .Forget the rest.

text:
I picked the Marriott as my company changed its preferred hotel policy. Usually I would stay at the Doubletree in Menteng area which is close to the CBD and good malls in Jakarta.
Check-in was smooth but that was the last of it.
Upon check-in, I couldn't get the lights and other things to work. Only the air-con was working. Called 3x for the engineers to come and fix it but I had to leave for a meeting. Upon return, I noticed that the wall keycard-holder had been somewhat fixed with a new keycard. Wanted to take a shower but the hot water didn't work. Again, called the engineering dept with no success. Went downstairs to inform the front desk as I had to leave for a dinner meeting. Came back and noticed the hot water still didn't work.

I gave up as I was too tired and took cold shower for the night and the morning after.

The kettle and kitchen stuff looked to be 20 years old. Can't imagine how much bacterias are in this room.

Went to check out and was informed that the Silverbird taxi is waiting to take me to the airport. Rushed down and the bell boy just looked at me puzzled. Sure enough, no one informed him or the taxi driver.

I can only say that I will NEVER return to this place.

I don't know what kind of country manager that the Marriott Group hired for Indonesia to agree to accept this place as one of their own.
title: They should call this hotel MA-RIOT ....extreme disappointment

text:
If only the reception service was as nice as the apartment rooms.

Stayed there for one night after my court wedding with my family and my husband's family. We booked our room through hotels.com and as always, Indonesian services are not so pleasant whenever a third party is involved. We booked 3 rooms under 3 different names, we were informed by hotels.com that all our bookings have been confirmed. It shouldn't take us more than 10mins to get our rooms - we were so dead tired after the whole wedding ordeal.
When we told them that we have 3 bookings, the 1st (guy) reception told us only 2 rooms were booked and that they didn't receive the other booking. We insisted that there are 3 bookings, that guy didn't do much to help us at all, and I, the bride, almost lost my temper. Thank God another reception came in and called their superior and tried to solve the problem.
After this guy look at the booking sheets again, HE DID FOUND THE 3RD BOOKING NAME (after he unproffesionally insisted there was no 3rd booking) - though it somehow didn't get registered to their system.

In the end we waited at the lobby for 30-45 minutes, with sore legs and lack of sleep. Only the bed, warm shower and my family made things worth while
title: A pleasent kind of apartment

text:
First time using these appartments in Jakarta.  Would I go back ....??  The jury is still out on that question!

Good location in terms of getting to many of the key business areas.  Apartments are very spacious, if in need of an up-grade and refurbishment.  They are somewhat old-fashioned in look and feel.

Very attentive staff.  All very polite and helpful.

The in-house catering leaves a bit to be desired.  Breakfast spread was not up to the Marriott brand's usual standard.  I ate dinner in on one occassion and the food served was just so-so.

The location seemingly isn't that well known to taxi drivers.  So I'd advise anyone to print off a clear map before going and while based there.  There's not a lot to do within the building or within easy walking distance - in terms of alternative restaurants, bars, etc.

Overall, I'd say it's decent value for money.
title: The space makes it

text:
Decided to stay at the Marriott Executive Apartments due to an early morning meeting in the vicinity considering Jakarta traffic. 
Taxi driver had some problems finding the place, Indofood Tower eventually did the trick in respect to clear directions to get there.
Check-in painless, rate acceptable. The rooms are big and for some the kitchen facilities may be of value. The property would certainly benefit from an upgrade, as other guests noted it looks a bit tired and run down. No rainshower in the bathroom and toilet not stopping to drip.
Check out was more painful. USD Rate gets converted at expensive hotel conversion rate (>5% over bank rate) into IDR. Payment in US dollars only possible in cash. I wish they would stop this stupid practice of trying to squeeze a few more dollars out of you and raise their rate by $5. It just feels cheap and leaves a bad taste when a 4 star property has to resort to such means.
Breakfast is nothing to write home about. Coffee was nice enough but sausages and potato slices cold, not much choice.
title: Time for an upgrade

text: Stayed for 1 week on business as solo traveller to be near clients. This is a self contained apartment complex with some extra hotel facilities.  Great if staying with others...a bit boring on your own, as no bar as such and restaurant is small and quiet.  Staff very friendly and attentive in restaurant and reception.  Overt (but not OTT) security in the lobby.  Pool was great (a bit cold!) & gym had plenty of aerobic stuff and free weights all in good condition. Food was tasty.  Apartment (1 bedroom) large, comfortable and pretty modern with 2 flat screen TVs, stereo, dvd player, & full kitchen / washing facilities.  I agree that more (any) accessible plug points for guests is required in the rooms.  MEGA building projects behind the Indofood Tower make for an 'interesting view' from the apartment!  Great location though, in heart of business district.  Would i stay again?  Yes if travelling with others (maybe), but probably no if solo - mainly due to being a little lifeless / quiet.
title: Big apartment, friendly staff, tasty food, good pool & gym - too quiet!

text:
I stayed at the Mayflower on Sep 19, 2014 in room 2902.

If you're looking for a hotel experience - which, unfortunately, I was - the Mayflower is not for you. It makes no pretenses about being an apartment...although far from an executive feel.

The room has certainly been lived-in. It looks a bit tired from the wear and tear. Nothing "executive" about it. 

It took forever for the houekeeping to send up a shirt.  Though I have to stay that the staff (David) at the Cafe was quite attentive and most helpful.

The photos on the website are much, much better than the real thing. As a rule, I think properties should include the dates when published photos were taken. But i guess that's what we tripadvisor-zens are supposed to do...to be the voice of reality in an otherwise glamorized world of corporate PR.  It would be good though if hotels kept themselves honest.

Construction work of the MRT in Jakarta also makes access to the Mayflower challenging, to say the least.
title: It's an Apartment...not quite executive

text:
Compared to several other service apartments in Jakarta, The Marriott Mayflower is very expensive. If money is not an issue, it's worth it to stay there. I stayed in a two bedroom apartment. The apartment is very spacious with a very nice big kitchen. The view was also great. 
The master bedroom has an ensuite large bathroom with modern amenities. The second bedroom was also quite big, the second bathroom was also quite big. It has a good washing machine with a dryer function too. The kitchen utensils, dishes and cutleries were quite good. They even provided basic needs for free such as cooking oil, washing powder, etc. on request. 
The disadvantages were that it's very difficult to get in to the apartment. The security checks were a few times which was not very practical for long staying guests. It's located in the business area. In the evening, when offices were already closed, the restaurants downstairs were closed too. It's not easy to find restaurants nearby within walking distance. You always have to go by car. 
The internet connection is not free and quite expensive.
title: A nice spacious apartment to stay but very expensive

text:
We spent 2 nights and find this apartment  is huge and comfortable. 
The condition is still new eventhough the hotel already 3yrs old. Would not say the location is gd but near enough to the Central where major malls are. By taxi it will cost you around Rp18K and Senayan about Rp20K. We did not take w breakfast as the hotel charge very exp. Plus this apartment located adjacent to office building where you can get food easily like Coffee Bean and 3 other local restaurants (but unfortunately the restaurants close on weekend). The apartment will be half full on weekend too (as it caters for business traveler

The lacking of this hotel; it provides basic toliteries - no toothbrush and paste, towel limited and only soap bar. unlike most hotels will provide complete set. Staff could not give proper info at times eg We plan to go Ancol ( the Jakarta Famous family Recreation Park) We get them to arrange for a taxi since it about 1hr drive. But when we arrived the place at 10am it was closed and only open in afternoon at 1.30pm. So we have to wait for more than 3hrs. The staff should have checked the info first when arranging the transport and advice us accordingly.

The gym, swimming pool and steam room are gd. Again if you go after office hrs it tend to be more crowded as the office ppl will use the facility also. This hotel is very quite on weekends and u see less ppl.
title: Decent stay and value for money

text: On our last leg through Indonesia, we've been at the Mayflower for little less than a week. It was a smart choice given our family size as we have a separate bedroom from our kids. The apartment was very serviceable, although we requested a different washer/dryer combo as the old one didn't dry. There is a breakfast buffet, but it has very little and not too impressive, as is the food ordered for room service. The pool is gorgeous tho as is the fitness centre. An amazing view 28 stories up. Love the amenities there. No problem with Internet for us but it is a modest additional charge. The lobby and entrance is through an office building, which is odd. We were also very surprised at the metal detectors and xray machines, but because of bombings, we've come to realize that it is a fact of life in Jakarta.
title: Good location with good rooms and pool

text: As all hotels were fully booked (due to the Obama visit) I still found a room at the Mayflower. and was pleasantly surprised by the apartments offered. The flat was very spacious with all comfort. Beside a comfortable bedroom, the flat had a large living room (and kitchen) and the hotel had a well equipped fitness and a large swimming pool.
title: good option in the business district

text:
I have just started a 5-month project in Jakarta and was looking at a serviced residence to stay at. I chose Marriott serviced apartment for its location and the brand name. What a terrible mistake it was.

My bad experience started when I checked into my apartment. Internet connection was not working, and kitchen appliances, especially the dishwasher, was filthy. A week into my stay here, the aircon broke down and instead of proactively informing me that there was a problem and providing me with an alternative solution, they waited until I called, three times, to tell me that something somewhere was leaking and they couldn't find it. The service and competence of the duty manager was appalling, and those of the hotel manager was the worst I've seen so far. 

This place is a perfect example of over-promising and under-delivering.
title: Worst service I've seen so far

text: My husband and I love the Mayflower Executive Apartments, the location is awesome! The bed is so plush and comfortable, great kitchen, and has a 1million dollars view. I was born in Jakarta and everytime we come to visit my hometown, the Mayflower is always the first choice. The room rate is not so high and the security to the building is tight. The ladies at the front desk and restaurant are all friendly and we didn't experience any slow service from them. We will be back!
title: This is home!

locations.name: The Mayflower, Jakarta - Marriott Executive Apartments
The Mayflower, Jakarta - Marriott Executive Apartments

text:
I have stayed in MayFlower in the 2 bedroom apartment before in the past. During that stay, everything is quite good except the slow service and issue of carpark that later settled after we asked to meet the supervisor (ended up the staff just lazy to do a little bit of work and just say that the service is not possible). The second time, we somehow still consider to stay over there again in 3 bedroom apartments, we have made reservation few months ahead to make sure the rooms are available. Today I was calling to find out regarding kitchen utility details and just found out that my name was not reserved at all. I was so disappointed to find out about it now and I was not contacted regarding the unavailability of the room eventhough my credit card is registered by them. The staff ask if they could help me to booked again today. I thought I would give them a chance again and make a reservation again as the staff said that there are 2 bedrooms apartments that are still available. few hours after that... I was contacted that the 2 bedrooms are also unavailable and if I would like, I am going to be placed in waiting list instead. 
They should have apologized regarding their first mistake & instead of fixing it, they create another mistake and disappointment to their customers.
I was VERY disappointed with Mayflower service.
title: Unreliable reservation system & slow service

text:
Been to Jakarta with friends and girlfriend 5 times the past year and always stayed at Mayflower. Good reception despite a bit slow.
Rooms are clean, huge (esp the executive 2-bdrm) and well-equiped. Very friendly service in the rooms.
Careful, room service is disgusting though but plenty of food in the area. 
View from the rooms and the pool is stunning.
Swimming pool is very nice too. Would recommend it for friends who go to Jakarta and want to have a large living space.
title: home away from home

text:
Stay at the Marriott Mayflower Jakarta for 6 nights with 2 kids in a one bedroom apartment. Things are still new (this is a new service apartment) but one night our we found a used condom under the sofa cushion in the living room. I called the housekeeping to removed it but no action taken afterward by the management except a brief apology by the manager on duty that night over the phone. So gross !!

The breakfast is very marginal and the staff is not friendly, especially with kids. So this service apartment is not kids friendly place. The only things nice there is the gym and the pool.
title: Could be better

text: We had a great time catching up with friends for iftar. Chafiz (I hope i get it right) with the other staff were very friendly and hospitable when we arrived. Had  a great tasty dinner. And i really meant this because not everyday we had such delicious food. Average food yes, but this is really tasty. We had the nasi madura package. And the desserts, which was the kueh were amazing to compliment it. I forgot the staff who clear up the dinner, thank you so much pak for being very nice and attentive. He noticed we could not finish the dessert/kueh and offered to bring some take away boxes. Once again, thank you for your great hospitality and have blessful Ramadhan for all of you.
title: Great Iftar Dinner - Super Tasty Foods

The Mayflower, Jakarta - Marriott Executive Apartments

text:
The location is very strategic, can be reached by TransJakarta or MRT. The distance to the KRL station is also not too far. Also close to a large shopping center.

I really like the indoor pool which is on the 28th floor. The pool is very big, complete with hot and cold whirlpool. There is also a sauna and steam room. The gym room is also very spacious.

The room I stayed in was a 2 bed room unit, very spacious and comfortable. Complete with dining area, fully equipped kitchen, Living area. The main bedroom has an en suite bathroom complete with a bathtub with a cityscape view.

For breakfast the menu is very diverse. The Cafe also serves lunch and dinner with quite a variety of ala carte menus. I also tried live cooking in the room. Chef Rangga who serves food very well. We can also ask a lot about the food menus that are served.

All the staff here are very friendly and helpful in every way. It's really nice to stay here
title: Great Location, Comfy Room, Great Pool

text:
We chose The Mayflower during our quarantine upon arrival in Jakarta and I couldn’t recommend better place to stay. Everything was so smooth. I had many flight delays and had to change the reservations few times. But the hotel team still managed to accommodate our request and provide the best service with clear communication. Everything was so smooth from the reservations, airport pick-up, registration, and the staffs were so welcoming and accommodating. The room was impeccable, spacious and clean. The food was tasty and delivered in a very hygienic manner. 
We originally booked for 3 days/ 2 nights quarantine but before we arrived, the government changed the regulations to 2 days/ 1 night stay for those who already completed booster vaccine. The hotel immediately informed us and modify our reservations, they were honest and didn’t try to rip us off or make us stay more. I really appreciate this gesture. 
Thank you so much!
title: Efficient, organized, comfortable stay

text:
I am a Marriott Bonvoy Gold level member and booked this hotel for a quarantine package based on reviews here, as well as the Marriott site.  

The staff here has an excellent attitude and try to be accommodating.  

I arrived by taxi from the airport after completing the Covid entry protocols.  Check-in was handled in my room and was efficient.  

I booked a "One Bedroom Superior" room, which was about 90 sq meters.  There was a main/common room that had the washing machine, kitchenette, table for 4, and TV area with seating for 4-5 people.  A door way in the between the kitchenette and dining table area led to the bedroom.  Inside the bedroom, there was a king size bed, TV, work desk, and bathroom/closet area.  If you have guests, they have to go thru the bedroom to get to the bathroom.   

Upon entering the room, it was immediately apparent that the photos on Marriott's website are VERY old.  The room is dated and worn down in every aspect.  Wood flooring is squeaky and warping, especially below the windows and at the entry to the bathroom.  The kitchenette is minimally equipped and not suitable for cooking anything other than the most basic of meals.  

The furnishings in the main room room are of low grade commercial quality.  They look OK in photos, but were not made for normal day to day home use.  The bedroom was equipped with similar low grade furnishings and a bed with a worn out mattress.  There was a bad attempt to update the closet area that is between the bedroom and the bathroom.  The materials are a totally different color and don't make efficient use of this space.  There was no place to put a medium to large suitcase like you find in most hotel rooms.  

The bathroom has a sink, shower, and separate bathtub.  In the photos, it look nice.  In reality, the wooden trays in the sink area are cracked and broken and there was a drain next to the toilet that had water coming up out of it every time I flushed the toilet.  Pretty gross.  

I was there for 3 days and 2 nights.  Never was able to get hot water in the shower, sink or bathtub.  Lukewarm at best - and that was only possible if you didn't turn on any cold water.  

The quarantine menu  looked decent, but EVERY meal was served cold.  The box it was served in felt warm, but even after complaining, I was still served cold meals.  The food was bland, with the meat and veggies overcooked.  Unlike my quarantine stay at the Shangri-La Jakarta, eating utensils, napkins, salt, and pepper were NOT provided with each meal.  Breakfast was served with coffee and orange juice, but no drinks were offered with lunch or dinner.  you can't order outside food/drinks - so I'm not sure why no drinks came with lunch or dinner - but for the package price, this was not expected.  When I asked why meals came with no utensils, I was told there were utensils in the room - and there are.  But you have to wash them after every meal.  Again, for the quarantine package price, this is ridiculous.  

The air conditioning was noisy and it was hard to control the temperature.  There were separate controls for the main room and the bedroom, but it was either too cold or too hot.  It was impossible to set a comfortable temperature.  

My room faced the street and significant road noise could be heard around the clock.  I have stayed at other hotels in Jakarta (Mulia, Crowne Plaza, Shangri-La) with rooms facing the street and not heard the level of road noise I experienced here at the Mayflower.  

Marriott Bonvoy members take note - While this is a "Marriott", they only give 2.5 points per dollar vs 10 points per dollar at "regular" Marriott properties.  They told me this was because they are "an apartment, not a hotel".  The room rates are similar to a hotel - so if points matter to you, you might want to explore Marriott's other properties in the the area.  

What makes this experience especially disappointing is that I spoke to two different people during my stay about the food being served cold.  Both of them were apologetic and said they would fix it, yet I still continued to be served cold meals. 

I was told to be ready at 5am on my last day of quarantine for my PCR test.  Someone came to my room well after 6am to administer the PCR test.  I was told I would have results by 2pm, so I booked a 4pm flight that day to fly to Surabaya.  My results were not available until 3:30pm - so I missed my flight and had to rebook it.  The hotel knows how many guests they have - don't tell me to be up at 5am and then show up to test me well after 6am.  And I'm not sure what lab they are using - but again, don't tell me test results and check out will be at 2pm and then be 90+ minutes late.   

Whether you are staying for a quarantine package or a regular hotel stay, I would proceed with caution if you are considering booking here.  The overflowing drain is a health hazard and I would have moved to a different hotel were it not for the fact that I was stuck there in quarantine.  

Based on my two quarantine stay experiences here in Jakarta, I would strongly recommend the Shangri-La Jakarta over the Mayflower.
title: Disappointing Experience

text:
Pros:
- Excellent location in the middle of the business area in Jakarta
- Easily accessible with public transports.
- Fast check in process and friendly staff.
- High level of cleanliness.
- High standard of service as other Marriott Hotels.
- Fast internet connection throughout the property.
- Large and comfortable room with unobstructed view of Jakarta.
- Great F&B offerings.
Cons:
- Sharing building/site with office space.
- The hot water did not work for the bathtub (addressed to the receptionist during check out).

Overall:
I am happy with my stay at MEA, my room was upgraded to 2 BR Suite. The food at The Cafe was great and delicious. All the staff was great. Fully recommended.
title: Business Serviced Apartment

I lived (not just stayed) at the Mayflower MEA, Sudriman Plaza Jakarta for 2+ years. I was staying alone and away from my family who I had left back in my home country.

MEA staff and facilities continuously made me feel at home with their outstanding service quality, guest empathy, courtesy and friendliness. The property is marvelous and the maintenance + housekeeping gets a 10/10 from me.

text:
I booked through Marriott Bonvoy apps for my best friend's wedding. Reading all of the reviews and most of the guests are complements their services. Indeed, their service is exceeding my expectations.
They help me from pre-stay, because I need to modify my bookings several times. During stay, from the security in B1 level, the one who help me during the check-in and arranged me taxi and takeaway breakfast because I need to left early. And post-stay, they reminded me that my driving license was left with them during check in. I'm giving them a perfect score here.
There was some issue with my dispenser in the room but after we called them, their engineering team was coming to check and replaced it with another one.
I was worried when I need to stay during this Covid situation but I saw that all of them were implementing the health and safety protocols ensures me that I don't need to be worried.
The room was bit old, but all the equipments and facilities were working well.  We even cooked some dishes during our stay. Unfortunately, we didn't have much time to ejoys their indoor pool overlooking the Sudirman area and their whirlpools.
Breakfast was served ala carte and you can ordered from the digitalized menu. We love their Marriott Breakfast -- the hashbrowns were really good!
Great job! Definitely will come back.
title: Excellent stay!

text:
(+) location is in the heart of Jakarta. for business especially, couldnt ask for better hotel
(+ very very spacious. got upgraded to 2 bedroom apartment, and felt like i could build a playground lol
(+) service is by far one of the best in Jakarta. very friendly and sincere. receptionist took me to taxi during check out. waited until taxi passed while bow down. Now, thats not something i see everyday in the city
(+) wifi, ac, shower, all work perfectly

(-) room is a bit old. but they are undergoing a soft renovation. hope to see them in a better face next time
(-) Marriott Bonvoy member only able to claim 1 status night after 3 eligible stay. good thing is, all calculated in one calendar year. so nothing goes to waste
(-) can be a bit noisy due to traffic

VERDICT
COMEBACK!
title: id give the service 10 stars, if its possible

owner_response.text:
Dear aguss08,

I am delighted to receive such great feedback from esteemed guests such as yourself and I want to thank you for taking the time to post this review on your experience at the Mayflower Jakarta, Marriott Executive Apartments.

I am happy to learn that you enjoyed the location, spacious and international standards amenities and the Marriott Executive Apartments Signature Service on offer. Our state of the art room offers panoramic views to our guests, giving them a feeling of being in the heart of the business district of Jakarta with direct access to MRT from the hotel building. 

I am glad you had a memorable time at the property and enjoyed every bit of the hospitality. We truly believe that the team is the backbone of our organization and your appreciation reinforces this belief. I will be sure to pass on your words of encouragement to our excellent team of associates!

Your feedback is an integral part of our operations and always helps us to deliver better, we have made the note of the room décor which you have correctly highlighted that we have started the renovation project of the hotel in phases, Marriott Bonvoy program is definitely our strength and gets our loyal guest to use the MEA brand hence your feedback is due taken and lastly we do have quiet rooms for you and will assign rooms away from main street noise for your future visits. 

We look forward to the opportunity to serve you again in the future and leaving you with another memorable experience of our hotel.

Warm Regards,

Shashank Sinha
General Manager

owner_response.text:
Dear PranavJ148,

text:
Our visit was a blast! My cousin booked a two-bedroom Deluxe Apartment for us and turned out, he secretly told the staffs about my birthday so upon arrival, they came to sing me a Happy Birthday and bring a small chocolate cake, much to my delight. I really appreciate their kind gesture. 

Talking about the apartment, the unit had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a kitchenette. All windows offered a breathtaking view of the city. Washing machine and ironing board were kept inside a cabinet in the hallway. The living area was spacious and able to accommodate 8 persons, including the four of us. At night, we welcomed our friends and had a small birthday party. The kitchenette allowed us to prepare some meal. With an amazing city view, the party was memorable and I was really happy. 

Design-wise, the apartment looked chic in a contemporary style. The lighting in the living area was somewhat too dim for my liking. The master bedroom had a King-size bed and a spacious closet. The second bedroom had a Queen-size bedroom. Each bedroom had a TV. What I liked from the master bedroom is its master bath, equipped with a long bathtub and big windows overlooking Sudirman street, perfect for relaxing. The marble floor could be slippery so we really had to be careful when walking, especially after taking a shower. 

The property's swimming pool is one of the biggest indoor hotel pools we've been I would say. There was also a kids pool. The pool area also had two whirlpools with a great city view. We also enjoyed their steam room and sauna, located inside the changing room. The gym was awesome, again with a breathtaking city view. 

Setiabudhi Astra MRT Station is right next to the premises, making commuting convenient. Overall, the staying experience was wonderful. We would like to thank the staffs, especially Ms. Pricilla, Mr. Daniel, Ms. Regina, Pa Supri, and Bu Vinda for the hospitality. We'd love to come back again.
title: Sweet Birthday Surprise, Great Big Pool, Spacious Living Area

text:
Simply Outstanding

My stays at Marriott Executive Apartments in Jakarta are simply outstanding.

The key is the staff. On my first visit, operations manager Vinda Warganegara went out of her way to introduce herself, make me feel welcome, and provide high-level assistance when needed throughout my stay.

In fact, the management team as a whole is top notch.  The manager named Fundi, for example, gave much needed and high quality assistance for a minor emergency that came up, with speed and grace.

Throughout my stay, whatever I needed was provided quickly, professionally and cheerfully.

It was also wonderful to have such a high quality breakfast service available in the hotel! The chef Rio offered special, delicious dishes for me, and Rama and the other staff there were friendly, skilled, and excellent in everything they did. I ordered dinner to be delivered from the kitchen several times during my stay, and loved it every time.

I appreciate the quality of the room, furnishings, and accommodations; and the service provided by the staff at every level. Ari and Samsul made me feel welcome every time I crossed paths with them, as well as many other friendly staff whose names I don't recall.

For the work I needed to do, the location was outstanding and central. And the apartment itself was perfect for the work I needed to do each day in the hotel; the layout, cleanliness, and provided features and amenities amplified my productivity during my stay.

And: I loved the views! Jakarta at night is such a beautiful city, and the view from my apartment was ideal for enjoying the sights, day and night.

As someone who is currently a business owner, but previously worked in private security, I must also commend the excellent security staff.  Part of living in modern Jakarta is that each time you enter a mall or large building, you go through a security screen. And the Mayflower's security staff is amazing at their job - both for the hotel proper, inside the building; and for Indofood Tower itself. They are professional and courteous, yet with the clear competence and strength to make one feel completely safe. I appreciate those who put themselves in harms' way to protect us all, and the security staff here is the best.

If you are reading this and looking for a premier-quality apartment to stay in central Jakarta - for short term, or long term - I completely and whole-heartedly recommend Marriott Executive Apartments.  And I do so without reservation. They can't be beat.

I look forward to staying at this location again each time my business brings me to central Jakarta. Terima kasih.
title: Simply Outstanding

text:
The Mayflower was the first time i stayed in a service apartment, just remember if you are concerned about Marriott points and or room nights you will not get them in full here for room nights its 3 nights for 1 night and i believe 3 dollars spend gets one point. So basically your only getting 1/3 that of any Marriott hotel.

The rooms are very large, nice view of the city. I had a single bed room, and i believe it was close to 100sqm which was more than enough for a single person occupancy. I didn't opt for the breakfast as it seemed very small and limited in selection. 

The staff greeted me at the entrance expecting my arrival which was nice and were very fast in checking me in and checking out as well as explaining the room and facilities. 

The rooms are a bit old but considering the size to cost i think its a good value. 

They provide a water dispenser which was constantly vibrating and making sounds but as the room was massive when i went to the bedroom it didn't bother me.

My only major issue which hit me a bit wrong but i accepted the payment. First i took silvercab, as i was told they take credit cards as i landed late at night and didn't have cash. My bill was 290,000 IDR a bit over US$20. The hotel told me they can pay for me, i was very happy as i didn't have to exchange my money at that point. So i accepted. When i checked out they charged me IDR460,000. This is their rate if they book the car for you and the car is waiting, I didn't have any of that service i waited in line at the airport to avoid such over price, so that did hit me negatively.

My second issue, they put a bottle of wine on the dinning table with a sign saying i qualify for 15% discount on wines and to call downstairs for the full list. I assumed this bottle was complimentary as i get it often in hotels. I was charge 950,000 IDR for a sub-par bottle of table wine in my opinion that is almost US$70! 

I paid both charges reluctantly but may this be a warning they rip you off on this so do not use these services. 

Put these issues aside and if you know how to avoid being ripped off the place is nice, the service was good. the location is ok, no real activities in walking distance so you will need to cab everywhere, and it is the worst traffic in all of Jakarta so be warned.
title: Large rooms in the center of town

text:
Rooms look nice and big however the place is aging and the service is very poor (expect no service except for check-in and check-out)

Breakfast room is small and fills in very quickly in the morning.
Location is on Jln Sudirman, notorious for traffic jams & noise. It's kind of convenient for people working in one of the office buildings nearby.
No amenities in the building, the closest shopping mall is ~20min walking distance. So make sure you do not forget anything

My first stay:
- Room not ready when I arrived in the afternoon
- Room service took 50 minutes to deliver. I ordered at ~9pm and could only eat at ~9.50pm
- Multiple issues in the room with noisy appliances (fridge, water dispenser)
- Air con is also very noisy and makes loud bangs in the middle of the night
- Phone: only 1 person at the reception answering, take your turn and be patient
- Food is definitely very average whether this is dinner or breakfast
- Pressing not delivered in the evening. Had to look for my clothes, check with reception in lobby (as I could not reach anyone by phone) and it only came the next morning at 6.30am
- No assistance for luggage on arrival or departure

In summary, it is a Marriot. Not as bad as in the USA but not as good as what one can expect. from 5* hotels in Indonesia
title: Avoid this place

text:
We stayed here for 3 nights and all of their staffs were very welcoming and made our stay a very pleasant one. 

We were upgraded to a 3br from a 2br upon arrive which were just icing on top of the cake. 

On the very last day, as we were trying to search for Bika Ambon, a delicacy that is more known in Medan, the Operations Manager Vinda herself helped us to search for it and even ordered it to be delivered to thr hotel. 

They were very understanding of their guests' needs such as universal adapter. They constantly asked if they could help out in any way. 

I have been to Jakarta many times, but I must say this is definitely up there especially if you're travelling in a big group. Its a reasonably priced hotel located near to all the major attractions and getting a taxi is very very easy. 

Id definitely stay here again the next time im in Jakarta. 

Thank you all for making our stay in Jakarta a memorable one!
title: Central location, great hospitality

text:
The Mayfair Marriott Executive Apartments is located in the business district of Jakarta. The apartments are spacious, tastefully decorated & well equipped for those wishing to be self sufficient on longer (or shorter) stays. The aircon keeps things comfortable with the option to self select temperatures, & rooms are equipped with wifi along with ample desk space - always welcome when working. A daily paper is delivered on request, & room service for meals et al available. Despite being on a very busy main road, the apartments are quite, with wonderful views.  
There is a pool & a gym for those who want them. While there is a menu for room delivery from the dining room in the evenings, the only thing that I would have appreciated was easier access to places to eat at night. There is a mini mart accessed via the ground floor for emergencies, & a few independent eating places ('italian', coffee) that close early - limited. As this is the business district, options that are easy to get to & offer the type of meals I would have appreciated as a busy working visitor (single) were very limited. I found out after I'd left that apparently there are ring & order/delivery type options - too late.  
However, by far the best thing about the Marriott Mayflower apartments is the service. Everyone, from security at the door, front desk, the dining room, maintenance, staff at the door, those who keep the rooms spotless is simply amazing. The staff work extremely well as a team & as individuals -  always courteous & obliging, never pushy or obsequious. Always willing to go the extra mile without request. Smiling &  friendly but always professional - service that I could not fault. I was very happy there for almost a month. Thaks to all the wonderful staff!
title: Home away from home

text:
I have stayed at the Mayflower apartments twice for business,  each stay 4 nights, as its convenient to Clients. As an apartment-style hotel and serviced residence,  its important not to expect 5 star hotel luxury (nor do you pay for this!).

The one bedroom apartments are spacious although if you wish to cook the kitchen has limited cookware and accessories.  I would suggest any business travellers note the following:

- there are no universal powerpoints but they can provide adapters (I had my own)
- there are not many available powerpoints, so often you need to unplug something to charge a device (including the bed lamp if you want to charge your phone overnight). If you have many devices you may want to bring a powerboard.
- the desk is a bit small and in the bedroom,  so I worked on the dining table but had to plug my laptop into the bedroom tv power outlet. 
- there is a minibar (at cost) which if needed is adequate
- if you're a light sleeper request a room that doesnt face Jln Sudirman as its a very noisy road with a bit of siren activity at night.

There were a few problems with my stay early on, however to the extent possible these were resolved immediately (or at least acknowledged for future resolution).  What was particularly appreciated was that these issues were broadly communicated to staff and management, who were all at pains to ensure everything had been addressed to my satisfaction during the rest of my stay.  The manager and head chef both introduced themselves to me at breakfast one morning and were very apologetic - I was addressed by name by both and by most of the staff which is a sign of good service training. 

I would say this is an establishment that wants repeat custom, and is therefore very focused on guest satisfaction,  which is to be commended.  I will be back when convenient for business travel.
title: Management focussed on guest satisfaction and improvement

text:
Its situated on a main street of city centre Jakarta in a large popular building with higher floors belonging to the hotel. The staff is super trained and extremely well versed and courteous to help you out in any way. Rooms are located on higher floors and give you a perfect view of the skyline. Got a free upgrade to a better room and was extremely spacious Beds are big and comfortable and has just about anything one needs in an apartment. 

The bathrooms are old fashioned marriott style which definitely needs upgrade when you compare to equivalent standard hotels. The bathtub is ok but the shower is too boring. The couch and dining area are perfect and have some good english channels on tv.

Spa is just amazing with some good Indonesian massage options. Jacuzzi and swimming pool are also very nice. 

Not many dining options around the area. But many malls in 2 km - 3 km radius (15 min driving time). Plenty of cabs and uber available. One very nice Italian place in the building lobby and a nice coffee shop. 

The breakfast room is small and has fewer limited options but very decent and tasty. For Indians traveling, they have few options in the 24 hour room service from Indian cuisine which were also quite tasty in case they decide to eat in sometime. 

Overall a great experience and would come back again for sure
title: A great Apartment Hotel in City Centre Jakarta

I have spent 50% of my time over the past 3 months staying in the Mayflower Marriott. The initial reason was that it was walking distance to my office but the reason I continued coming back to the hotel was despite there being newer options available, the team at the Marriott were so fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble and there were times when I ordered meals that did not exist on the menu and the chef would not only create them but would bring them to my room to ensure that it was exactly what I had in mind. There were times when I arrived to the hotel in the early hours of the morning, and the front desk team would come to my room to authorize my credit card so that I could get settled in quicker, knowing that I would need to be in the office the next day. 

I would have absolutely no hesitations on recommending Marriott and am grateful to the team for making it a home away from home for me.

text:
First off I feel somewhat bad giving the three star rating although I probably would have rated it with two stars if the staff had not been super friendly and the price not been quite affordable. That being said, unfortunately the best price and best service cannot make up for a sleepless night which is what I unfortunately ended up having. 

Although completely beyond the control of the hotel, there is loud construction going on throughout the night which my room was facing and I was not able to sleep at all, even when moving into the other bedroom which was only partially facing the construction site. Once construction nearby is complete I would recommend this place, especially at current prices. It is a good place for long stays as the rooms have washing machines and a full fridge. I stayed in a 2-bedroom unit which was huge and had two bathrooms. This would be an ideal unit for families and or groups of friends. The rooms do appear slightly dated and not at the same quality level as typical Marriott hotels in Asia. This is however to be expected given that you get 3x the floor space at the Mayflower compared with other Marriott properties in Jakarta at similar rates.

Please note that this is a serviced apartment so don't expect full hotel service, e.g. breakfast was much simpler than what you might expect at other Marriott properties.

In summary, very friendly staff, enormous rooms in ok maintenance condition but currently issues with construction noise nearby.
title: Huge rooms in ok shape but experience ruined by 24/7 construction on two sides

text: The Mayflower Marriott Executive Apartment is an apartment style accommodation suited more to those staying long term however it is also very much suitable for short stays. Location is perfect right in the middle of Jakarta CBD within walking distance to major office buildings, the only drawback is that the area is alive only during daytime on weekdays while weekends are mostly quiet as this is a business area. The hotel is in the same building as Indofood Tower occupying the top floors of the office tower, there are several restaurants and coffee place on the ground floor of the office tower. The 1 bedroom apartment is spacious and nicely maintained, cleaned and equipped with kitchen, washing machine, 2 TVs, DVD player, stove & all the necessary amenities for guests staying on longer period. There is an indoor swimming pool and gym on the 28th floor. They also have a small cafe that served breakfast and 24 hours room service. Ordered food from the room service and not too happy with the food unlike other Marriott property, taste is bland and presentation is so standard perhaps because this is an apartment not a hotel? Not too many electrical socket inside the apartment as well to charge your various devices as most of them are being used for the lamps or electronic devices. The only empty socket is located in not so convenient place i.e. Behind the TV or inside the bathroom. Water pressure especially hot water could also be improved as the water is only slightly warm, more cold than warm to be exact. Given its location and spaciousness, it is a good alternative to staying in hotels and rates are quite attractive as well.
title: Great Alternative to Hotels

text:
My husband had a business trip to Jakarta so it was the office that arranged for the hotel. The room was comfortable in the sense that there's a lot of space for just two people, but given a choice, I would book elsewhere. Here's why:

1. Breakfast is very basic and not great. I've had much better meals at smaller hotels that are not even part of an international chain.

2. We had dinner at the café one night and when we needed our bill, no one was around. I tried calling out to the staff inside the kitchen three times, but they could not hear me. Good thing the front desk agent a few meters away saw me and gave our bill, otherwise we could have walked away without paying.

This also happened again when I returned the next day to place an order. The staff were nowhere to be found when I entered the café and had to call out "Hello, anybody home?" a few times before someone attended to me.

3. The soap dish had old soap leftover by previous guests and the toilet needed cleaning.

4. One kitchen drawer needed repair and the gap cover below the oven fell off every time I opened the oven door.

5. Thick dust that can easily be reached by a vacuum nozzle and a water dispenser with what I assumed were coffee stains. Take note the picture attached is after I wiped some off. It then makes you wonder how long the water has been sitting there.

6. The refrigerator shelves needed a bit of wiping, but that was minor compared to the state of the oven.

7. There were no mosquitoes, but something always seemed to be biting me whenever I'm in the room.

8. I called Guest Services on two separate occasions to ask how much local phone charges cost and was told by two different people that it's less than IDR 5000 per minute to a landline. I made a seven (7) second phone call to my husband's office and was charged IDR 11,217. Take note that the phone just rang 5 times and I didn't even get to talk to anyone.

9. There is not much nearby in terms of food or malls except for The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf outlet on the ground floor along with a Japanese restaurant, but both are closed at 8 PM and on weekends.

In addition, the traffic makes you not want to get out because even at 10:30 AM or 3 PM, you can easily rack up a rather huge cab bill. I think only on Sundays and public holidays can you get relief from the traffic jams.

There is a pharmacy (Guardian), but that too is closed during weekends. The only silver lining is the small convenience store that is open everyday until 9 PM.

So was there anything about the hotel that I did like? Yes. First is that they had more TV channel options than other hotels I've been to (which I believe is typical of serviced apartments). And second, the staff were friendly - when they're around.

Tips:

- Grab one of the hotel's business cards at the lobby and keep it in your wallet. Some taxi drivers do not believe that there is a Marriott at the Indofood Tower and will refuse to leave until they've made sure you understand that.

- If coming from Plaza Senayan or Pacific Place Mall, best to ask the taxi driver to drop you off at Wisma Nugra Santana which is the building across the street from the Indofood Tower and take the overhead foot bridge back to the hotel. Otherwise, you'll have to go all the way to the rotunda near Grand Indonesia to make a U-turn. The highway unfortunately does not have breaks in-between and the traffic is so terrible that what is supposed to be a 5 minute trip, ends up taking close to an hour.
title: Given a choice, I would book elsewhere.

text: This property is an apartment-style luxury accomodation catering for businessmen in an extended stay in Jakarta. Located in the main thoroughfare of Jalan Jenderal Sudirman, it is located on the high floors of the Indofood Tower at the Sudirman Plaza, an office building complex smack in the Jakarta's central business district. However, during weekdays one must be prepared to fight the notorious Jakarta traffic jam to get in and out of the property. Each apartment offers a fully equipped kitchen, private laundry room, a dining table, a living area consisting of a couch and LCD TV and a separate, hardwood-floor bedroom area. The bed and pillows are ultra comfortable, one of the best I have ever slept in! Couple that with the high floor location, then you are guaranteed an excellent sleep experience! Service is great too. Only drawbacks are the PAID internet and the somewhat limited dining options (both at the small on site restaurant and in-room). This could well be problematic during weekends where the other FnB outlets in the office complex shut down.
title: Luxurious apartment-style accomodation in central Jakarta CBD

text:
Much Less than expected

From the start...the hotel had an agent/employee (?) meet me at the airport when I exited the baggage claim area right after customs.  I just happened to turn left and a man was there who greeted me by name, but no sign.  I had prebooked a taxi with the hotel at 360,000 for myself only; however, the agent showed me to a large van.  I kindly reminded him that I had a written confirmation for a Mercedes car, not a large van.  The Mercedes is comfortable, but nothing so special since there are many to choose from just waiting outside the airport, no need to book in advance.  In fact, the agent just 'flagged' down a Mercedes car that drove by; then, said a few words; and, off I was to the hotel.

A fairly quick drive to the hotel was about 20 mins from the airport, but I arrived late Sunday night!  Otherwise, be prepared for heavy, heavy traffic during morning and evening rush hours, especially during the week!! 

Ok, first...the breakfast was very poor.  I think my stomach got upset from the lesser quality of food.  Also the variety of food was...very poor.  It felt as if the breakfast was just laid out in the middle of a bar, the food easily became dry, and was just very plain.  No way was it close to 3-star quality!  (Seriously!) Not typical of the Mayflower Executive (?) Apartment brand whatsoever!   If I were a long term guess, I would surely be tired of the breakfast within a few days! 

Second, the room was just OK, but mine suffered from the smell of smoke and the cooking from one of the other apartments.  Housekeeping sprayed the room and opened the window for a while, but it did not help matters.  And can hear the movement of chairs from the surrounding apartment.

Very basic apartments with dated furniture.  My room had full tile floor in the living and kitchen areas, and wooden floor in the bedroom.  Kinda of a very cold and hollow feeling, not like a home.  Good storage area, and a nice-sized bathroom, but with only one sink.  Good sized frig, microwave oven, and a dishwasher.  Kitchen area seemed very adequate, and had toaster, rice cooker and coffee maker too.  There was a fairly new Samsung combo clothes washer/dryer which was nice to have, a full sized bottled water machine, as well as some basic cooking pans and utensils, drinking cups and plates.   Bed was comfortable though.

But, nothing to write home about, and I don't think I will stay again for any length of time. Even the reservation desk is at the back of the large building.  Felt so strange....I moved to the JW Marriott after two nights.
title: Much Less Than Expected!

text:
Stayed here in November 2013 and chose the Two Bedroom Executive Apartment. The room was big and had enough space to accommodate our family of four. We requested one roll-away bed and still had plenty of room to move around. Room was very clean, bed was comfortable, shower pressure was perfect; and complimentary water from the water cooler made our stay very pleasant. Room comes with a kitchen (no microwave) and a standard size refrigerator. There's also a Washer / Dryer combo unit which works well with washing clothes but a terrible job with drying. Breakfast was complimentary and was standard buffet with a mixture of western and Asian food. Not the best but sufficient since traveling outside is nearly impossible with the traffic and questionable food stalls. Internet isn't free in the room but offers decent speed. The swimming pool was very clean and long. The water wasn't heated but in a tropical country; the dip is absolutely refreshing. The only problems my family had with the hotel lies with the staff. Although most of them spoke good English, there were two instances where they dropped the ball. On our two days, we requested a private car through Golden Bird. The driver of the vehicle was polite but could only speak broken English. When we returned that evening, we requested a driver who can speak better English. The result: we ended with a driver who spoke almost no English or about the same level with the previous one. The other issue was the front desk misquoting us the rate for using Golden Bird outside of Jakarta; to sight-see another attraction.  Aside from these two issues; the hotel did arrange our round-trip transportation from the airport properly; using Silver Bird. Early in the morning, you may hear the loudspeakers from some of the nearby mosques in the vicinity of the hotel; regardless of your room location.

Keep in mind that this hotel is located right in the center of Jakarta, so expect heavy traffic regardless of the time of day. At one point, it took my family more than an hour to get from the expressway off ramp to the car garage of our hotel. Regardless of where you enter the hotel; you will be required to go through a security checkpoint. Since Jakarta has been hit by terrorist attacks in the past; security will be tight.

Despite the issues my family had; this hotel felt like our home away from home. I would stay here again if I came back to Jakarta.
title: Met our Marriott expectations with some issues

I booked a one bedroom apartment for a short stay. It has everything one needs but is basic. Size is ok, but rooms are narrow and long. Space between bed and TV is hardly enough.
